reviews.text:
I booked this place after seeing high reviews on booking.com. Firstly, the hotel staff were very nice and accommodating to my requests, but I wanted to write a review about the hotel itself. My stars go to their kindness and hospitality. However, this hotel was not for me and did not justify the price. Upon arrival, I was informed that there would be a cycling competition happening the next day with loud music outside the hotel and lots of people coming in on site. There was also a wedding party in the hotel that night, which ended around 12:30 am. If you are looking for a quiet, serene stay, you might need to check with the hotel to see if there are any events happening during your stay.

The breakfast lacked quality - instant coffee, no black tea, the orange juice had gone bad (they replaced when I notified) the muesli was stale, no unsweetened yogurt, and the cucumbers and tomatoes looked dry. I didn‚Äôt see any cheese options other than brie and cottage cheese. The bread didn‚Äôt have much flavor, and there was no fish.

The location is great, with a garden view close to the Nordic Museum, √ñstermalm, and T-Centralen. However, this is not a boutique hotel where everything is prepared with love and care.

Very quite place with great access to public transportation and trails.  The breakfast is very good and the outdoor patio, ice cream stand and bar are fantastic. Rooms are spacious with great AC and WiFi.  Restaurant service was excellent.  Front desk was not very helpful on a couple of occasions, thus dropping off a star for service.  Would stay here again the sure.

Great location with their garden, especially during the summer.

I loved their chicken parmigiana and creme brul√©e. Also a good place for bringing a visiting delegation or family and friends. From Villa Kallhagen you can explore the neighbouring park or go to Djurg√•rden.

i didn't know about the hotel

but the food was very good! 5/5
this chicken was so delicious!

the pastry and breakfast buffet were good too!

Nice hotel, friendly front desk staff, but WHAT is going on with the breakfast?!

Very limited vegetarian options and super cramped buffet table with no place to lay down your plate so that you could actually scoop something onto it. And when the staff wasn't ignoring guests, they behaved like we were a massive inconvenience to whatever else they were all preoccupied with ü§∑üèª‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è

Bizarre at an otherwise nice hotel.
